Articles.Content:
So, after playing around with the new mk3 parts and am very pleased with how they turned out. They are beautiful parts that will fit nicely within the game. However, I feel as though the wings and control surfaces that we have now are a little too small for large/long-range spaceplane configurations using mk3 parts. Using the wings we have now, it seems that a truly large number of parts are need to produce a really good amount of lift.

I personally like using spaceplanes for long range heavy lifting on Kerbin, and having a high part count can be a pain.

Does anyone else feel this way?

P.S. I love how much the game has progressed from when I started playing, and congratulations to squad for KSP reaching Beta!

I came here looking to post the same thing. And it's not so much the size of wings, as the complexity of keeping those large wings made of tiny pieces from falling apart. I made a jumbo jet (replica of one of the ones shown when the first unveiled the Mk3 parts) and the wings just flopped all over the place and cracks opened between the pieces. I ended up having to strut all the individual pieces together.

There really needs to be a way to make attached wing pieces mold into a single part. It's like having a wing made of Legos.
Part wielding plugins may work, or try procedural wings or procedural parts.

I'd like some larger wings, though I don't think they're necessary. The new editor categories make part clutter much less of a problem, so adding a ton of new parts would be fine as long as it doesn't take up too much memory.

I think I might make a bunch of configs to add rescaled stock wings. I already added some larger stock landing gear to my game.

Edited December 19, 2014 by xub313

What I want are larger control surfaces; the current ones are just small, when compared to Delta wings, i'd rather not have to use twice as many control surfaces than wings. That's what I think a large portion of space-plane part counts go to.
Agreed, a scaled up version of each wing part would be useful. Especially the control surfaces, they're so puny!

Ok, so I quickly made some larger wings and control surfaces. And I have to say they fit quite well with the Mk3 parts.

I still need to go over the lift values. Lift should go up with the square of the multiplier right? I know the square-cube law but i'm no aerodynamics nut.

Ok, so I quickly made some larger wings and control surfaces. And I have to say they fit quite well with the Mk3 parts.

http://i.imgur.com/4n16hB7.png

I still need to go over the lift values. Lift should go up with the square of the multiplier right? I know the square-cube law but i'm no aerodynamics nut.

It's more a matter of geometry than aerodynamics. Double the dimensions and you square the surface area, and therefore the lift.
For the moment I'm getting by on using two layers of wing parts for my mk3 planes - looks better (thicker looking wings) and is more flyable too.

I am hoping we get bigger landing gears also!

I made a post about mk3 parts a few days ago, of course it got moved to a sub form that no one reads and died... GG mods
I heard Porkjet was working on new landing gear.

I heard Porkjet was working on new landing gear.

And larger wings.

I'm hanging out for some chunkier stock jets, personally; having to strap 8+ turbojets on just to get off the runway isn't the best. Stock 2.5m jets, maybe?

And larger wings.

I'm hanging out for some chunkier stock jets, personally; having to strap 8+ turbojets on just to get off the runway isn't the best. Stock 2.5m jets, maybe?

Yeah, you need a lot of thrust and the current jets can't provide it.
Honestly if any landing gears were to become stock I would HIGHLY suggest BDs Adjustable landing gear. One of the best mods of 2014.
We also need a proper tail section (engine mount). Why that wasn't included I don't know.

We also need a proper tail section (engine mount). Why that wasn't included I don't know.

Do you mean like these? http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Mk3_to_2.5m_Adapter_Slanted

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/C7_Brand_Adapter_Slanted_-_2.5m_to_1.25m

I still need to go over the lift values. Lift should go up with the square of the multiplier right? I know the square-cube law but i'm no aerodynamics nut.

When the scale increases lift should go up by the square (since you're scaling up both width and length). Volume goes up by the cube, so mass should increase by more than the square, but a wing should be mostly empty, so squaring the mass should be close enough.

The drag value scales with mass automatically, so you shouldn't change it.

I'm hanging out for some chunkier stock jets, personally; having to strap 8+ turbojets on just to get off the runway isn't the best. Stock 2.5m jets, maybe?

YES. I have a 216 ton SSTO (using mark 3 cargo bays), and the part count is over 400. With larger engines and wings (and intakes) it wouldn't lag so much. I would also advocate for 2.5m intakes.
I'd love to get some smaller jets, too. You can't build a LearJet with the current engines -- they're 10x too powerful.
I would love to see procedural wings become a stock thing. They are far more handy and less parts then the current system of lego wings.
Yes. Definelitely I want procedural wings,or something that can make all wing parts into one piece. (also i always wanted smaller jet engines ^^ )

Yes. Definelitely I want procedural wings,or something that can make all wing parts into one piece. (also i always wanted smaller jet engines ^^ )

Honestly is it sad that I delete most of the cfgs for almost every wing part out there except Pwings and a few smaller bits.
It would be nice it there was a "2x scale" button or something like that. I generally have to build my wings out of twice the parts I need. I'm happy with the wing size though.

Here is a bunch of config files to add rescaled wings and landing gear to fit the Mk3 parts. I admittedly spent little time testing it, but everything looks alright. It includes most of the stock wings and control surfaces and as two larger landing gears.

Edit: I realized that I made a huge mistake with the balancing. I'll fix it in a couple minutes.

Edit: Done

Edited December 19, 2014 by xub313

It would be nice it there was a "2x scale" button or something like that. I generally have to build my wings out of twice the parts I need. I'm happy with the wing size though.
